title: SoC THEATRE 367-0-21 Music Theatre History

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course will focus on the evolution of musical theatre in the U.S. from the early 20th century up to our current times. We will look at the foundations, development and various manifestations of this uniquely "American" art form, examining it in relation to social, cultural, and economic history. This will entail analysis of individual musicals, a contextual overview of the major players within the field, and an unpacking of the industry that surrounds and forms the conditions within which musical theatre is created and practiced. We will be digging into the past to better understand current developments within musical theatre, both within the Broadway paradigm and outside of it.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
demonstrate a working knowledge of significant musicals, artists, and eras of American musical theatre
identify the characteristics of specific types of musicals
understand the relationship of musical theatre to American culture and society
articulate the economic systems that have impacted and continue to shape musical theatre production
recognize contemporary iterations of musical theatre across artistic genre
